feed.title: Current Watches, Warnings and Advisories for the United States Issued by the National Weather Service

entry.title: Blizzard Warning issued April 01 at 4:58AM AKDT until April 02 at 12:00AM AKDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...BLIZZARD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL MIDNIGHT AKDT TONIGHT... * WHAT...Blizzard conditions occurring. Travel will be very difficult to impossible. Winds gusting to 50 mph will cause whiteout conditions in blowing snow. Significant drifting snow is likely. Cold wind chills to 50 below zero are occuring. Wind

entry.title: Wind Advisory issued April 01 at 4:53AM AKDT until April 01 at 6:00PM AKDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...WIND ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 6 PM AKDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Northeast winds 25 mph with gusts up to 40 mph. * WHERE...Over Summits of the Steese Highway. * WHEN...Until 6 PM AKDT this evening. * IMPACTS...Large snow drifts will form. Blowing snow may briefly reduce visibility.

entry.title: Flood Warning issued April 01 at 11:27AM EDT until further notice by NWS

entry.title: Flood Warning issued April 01 at 11:27AM EDT until April 05 at 2:00AM EDT by NWS

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued April 01 at 9:09AM EDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...FIRE DANGER STATEMENT IN EFFECT UNTIL 6 PM EDT THIS EVENING... The combination of wind gusts up to 25 mph, minimum relative humidity of 25, and limited rainfall in the last couple of days will lead to an increased risk of adverse fire weather conditions today over portions of southeastern North Carolina. Outdoor burning is strongly discouraged in these areas. Please

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued April 01 at 8:34AM EDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...INCREASED FIRE DANGER TODAY... West winds 10 to 15 mph with gusts to 25 to 30 mph and relative humidity values dropping to 20 to 30 percent will bring an increased fire danger to much of eastern North Carolina today.
